justification: A-centric rationale with little modeling of B’s motives. Ignores B’s preference to buy low on injured players (making them less likely to sell Tyler Anderson) and their dual-threat QB emphasis. Doesn’t mention Anderson’s Doubtful status or B’s TE depth. The trade is plausible (A needs TE, B could use RB help), but paying a Tier 1 RB for an injured TE is risky for A’s conservative style. Minimal, non-evidence-based explanation.
